input: question: What fraction of Michigan's homicides occurred in Detroit? [SEP] sentence: Nearly two-thirds of all murders in Michigan in 2011 occurred in Detroit.

question: What are examples of a cell's external environment? [SEP] sentence: Gene expression can be regulated at any step: from transcriptional initiation, to RNA processing, to post-translational modification of the protein.

question: How many Armenians were slaughtered between 1894-1896 [SEP] sentence: When they began pushing for more rights within the Ottoman Empire, Sultan ‘Abdu’l-Hamid II, in response, organized state-sponsored massacres against the Armenians between 1894 and 1896, resulting in an estimated death toll of 80,000 to 300,000 people.

question: What is fundamentally different from older notions of race? question: When was the status of Dominions as equal autonomous communities given legal force? [SEP] sentence: After pressure from Ireland and South Africa, the 1926 Imperial Conference issued the Balfour Declaration, declaring the Dominions to be "autonomous Communities within the British Empire, equal in status, in no way subordinate one to another" within a "British Commonwealth of Nations".

question: What is the second most common minority group in Nanjing? [SEP] sentence: As in most of eastern China the ethnic makeup of Nanjing is predominantly Han nationality (98.56 percent), with 50 other minority nationalities.

question: Who oversees the period of reckless behavior? [SEP] sentence: The festivities end on Ash Wednesday with elaborate funeral rituals marking the death of King Carnival, who is typically burned on a pyre in what is called the burial of the sardine (enterrament de la sardina), or, in Vilanova, as l'enterro.

question: According to Dulles, why was Diem made president of Vietnam? [SEP] sentence: Although Diem was publicly praised, in private Secretary of State John Foster Dulles conceded that Diem had been selected because there were no better alternatives.

question: In what provinces is the Carnival mainly celebrated in the Netherlands? [SEP] sentence: Although traditions vary from town to town, some common characteristics of Dutch Carnaval include a parade, a "prince" plus cortège ("Jester/adjutant and Council of 11"), a Peasant Wedding (boerenbruiloft), and eating herring (haring happen) on Ash Wednesday.

question: What method formally adds inverses to elements to any monoid? [SEP] sentence: There is a general method to formally add inverses to elements to any (abelian) monoid, much the same way as (Q ∖ {0}, ·) is derived from (Z ∖ {0}, ·), known as the Grothendieck group.
question: Decisions of the Dutch Supreme Court are called what? [SEP] sentence: Its decisions, known as "arresten", are absolutely final.

question: Where did the first semi-permanent residents of the Antarctic area live? [SEP] sentence: The first semi-permanent inhabitants of regions near Antarctica (areas situated south of the Antarctic Convergence) were British and American sealers who used to spend a year or more on South Georgia, from 1786 onward.
